title: Front-End Architects, Developers, and UI/UX Developers
desc:
We are developing cutting-edge technology to solve even harder problems in education.

NovoEd is a student-centered online learning environment that emphasizes collaboration and teamwork through techniques in human-computer interaction, algorithms, and social network design.  We make online learning engaging and effective through our social learning environment (platform) and courses optimized for project-based learning (content).  Based in San Francisco, CA, our small team has already built the most advanced online learning and collaboration platform, which offers both free and paid classes.

Together we leverage technology to improve student learning and make a quality education scalable and accessible to everyone.  Currently we are:

  • Improving college graduation rates by 100% by tackling remedial math
  • Bringing the price of a college degree within reach of millions
  • Increasing online course retention rates by more than 10x
  • Measuring learning outcomes across millions of students  
  • Applying social incentives & gamification to learning at scale
The list goes on and on.  We’ve already made great progress, but we need your help to do even more.  We are growing rapidly and hiring across the board, with particular emphasis on front and back-end software engineers and course designers (educators). FRONT END ARCHITECTS, DEVELOPERS, and UI/UX DESIGNER DEVELOPERS

Join us to shape the future of online education and to make our vision a reality. At NovoEd, you will work with smart, passionate, and creative people to solve challenging problems and create solutions that impact hundreds of thousands of students immediately.

The NovoEd Team is looking for designers to create intuitive, easy-to-use and fluid user experiences, as well as front end developers to build the most advanced online learning environment.  Challenges include:

  • Designing a (cross) culturally-relevant learning environment that is easy to use for millions of students from a wide variety of sociodemographic backgrounds
  • Architecturing a social news feed to stream relevant student-generated content, including projects and forum posts, while protecting academic integrity and privacy
  • Design a scalable, modular and test-driven frontend framework and architecture
  • Building a custom A/B testing framework for cross-class and ethnographic testing
  • Visualizing complex student and class data to highlight useful insights
  • Ensuring students on the go can watch videos, submit assignments, and interact in class from their mobile device
  • Seamlessly integrating students’ existing online behaviors and social paradigms with their learning experience on NovoEd
  • Engineering synchronous collaborative work environments, akin to Google Docs and virtual whiteboards, that can support hundreds of simultaneous users
We use JQuery, SASS, Compass, CSS3, HTML5, bootstrap, backbone.js and HAML in our frontend. Working knowledge of these languages and frameworks is a plus.  In addition, we are looking for web application engineers, full-stack and back-end developers,  course designers, course operations specialists, a business operations manager, recruiting coordinator, product marketing managers, business development associates, and more.  

If you’re passionate about education and sharp as a tack, we have plenty for you to do!  Send us an email at career@novoed.com with a proposal. Visit http://novoed.com/careers for more information and to apply.

about:
Sessionbox is a stealth mode, seed funded start-up company located in San Francisco. 

We are Instrumenting modern web application frontends which is hard. They're increasingly large and complex. They're coupled with remote API services. They run on networks and clients with limited resources. And they're driven by non-deterministic input sources: human users.

How are we doing this?

We've opened up the hood in a new way, enabling full x-ray visibility into the front-end (and a lot more that will surface in due time). 

Ok, we know. That's a little cryptic. We look forward to being able to say more, and in the meantime, if you're really curious, try reverse-engineering what we're doing from our jobs page. You'll see we have some tasty ingredients.
title: Front End Developer - Core IMD (Instrumentation, Monitoring, Diagnostics)
skills:
Qualifications:

  • Demonstrable expertise with multiple programming languages
  • BS/MS in Computer Science or closely related field

Bonus:

  • Experience creating browser plugins and/or extensions.
  • Familiarity with WebKit or Blink internals.
  • Experience using Firebug.
  • Experience as a team or project lead
desc:
Job Description

How is your frontend running today?

The frontend is what customers see and touch. It's the most visible part of a web application, yet it's the part that vendors have the least visibility into. Their business depends on it, but it's hard to know how well it's running in production.

It's time to make things better, so we're opening up the hood in a new way.

First stop: enabling full client-side visibility in production.

desc:
Job Description

Radio Systems Corporation has been the industry leader in developing pet training solutions, electronic containment systems, safety and lifestyle products since 1991. The E-Commerce department supports over 17 web properties that collectively serve 4 million unique visitors per year. The primary sites include PetSafe.net, SportDOG.com, and InvisibleFence.com. We’re seeking a creative Web Designer with a passion for UX to create positive online experiences that support customers and drive sales.

You will:

• Work with brand and creative teams to deliver a consistently great brand experience to consumers.

• Participate in creating the content and product education strategy for each website.

• Work closely with the web development team to implement design templates and front-end code.

• Employ creative application of information architecture, color palettes, typography, iconography and photography assets.

• Utilize user stories, wireframes, mockups, etc. where appropriate.• Research, incorporate and regularly update search engine optimization best practices into site design.

skills:

joeltest: • Do you use source control?
• Can you make a build in one step?
• Do you make daily builds?
• Do you have a bug database?
• Do you fix bugs before writing new code?

• Do programmers have quiet working conditions?
• Do you use the best tools money can buy?

desc:
Job Description

GenesisPath is a software development company currently building a personnel management web application for a large client. During the course of the development cycle, we have discovered that we need to use Knockout to support the complexities of one particular section of the application. Unfortunately, most of our development team has only light experience with Knockout.

Our Senior Application Architect has written a shell in Knockout, but we need an expert in MVVM and Knockout to help us finish this out. This relationship could lead to a long-term software development role with our company. (Our development team specializes in web and tablet applications using .NET and SQL, but we need someone with advanced Knockout skills to help us complete this portion of the application.)

You will be able to work remotely on this project from anywhere in the US. We will provide access to the Dev Server, provide documentation for the application, data models, etc.

Applicants must live in the US and be eligible to work in the US on a 1099 contract basis. 
We are not currently sponsoring H1B Visas, providing W2 position, nor personnel located outside of the US.

desc:
Job Description

GIS application designer and developer experienced in using ArcGIS Runtime SDK for WPF and integration with ArcGIS Server. South Plainfield, NJ 07080.

Position Description:

4D Security Solutions is looking for a senior software engineer with extensive ESRI GIS development experience for a short-term assignment to consult our software development team on integration with Esri products using ArcGIS Runtime SDK for WPF. The right candidate will review with the team our current solution, recommend design enhancements, implement blocks of integration code, as well as suggest strategy for further integration steps. The focus will be on the following topics:

  • Best practices for integration with ArcGIS Server

-      User Authentication

-      Usage of available geospatial resources

-      Publishing geospatial data to the server

  • Navigation through the content of ArcGIS Server

-      Loading maps from the server

-      Switching maps

-      Control presentation of layers on the map

  • Performance considerations when integrating ArcGIS technology working with local and remote data
  • Best practices for incorporating ArcGIS technology in a WPF application working with local geospatial data

-      Work with files in TPK, MPK, GeoTiff formats and Shapefiles

-      Invoke geospatial tools

Additional topics:

  • UI considerations when providing applications to experienced Esri users
  • ArcGIS technology for mobile devices

title: Senior .NET Developer

desc:
Are you a Talented & Technically Curious Developer who is looking to be a part of a ROCKSTAR team? 

If you answered “YES”, then LoopNet may be the place for you. 

LoopNet is looking for an innovative Sr. .NET/C# Developer to join our team in our San Gabriel Valley, Glendora office. You will be part of a highly skilled development team working with the latest Microsoft technologies (.NET framework, C#, SQL, etc). You will work closely with other departments (Import Operations, Research, Client Services, and Product Development) to develop stand alone and Intranet-based applications, tools and utilities. Development is done in a collaborative process where input and expertise will help influence the overall requirements/design that affect the $11trillion commercial real estate industry.  This is a great position for a self-motivated “out of the box” thinker.

LoopNet, Inc., part of CoStar Group,  is the leading information services provider to the commercial real estate industry, and operates the largest and most heavily trafficked commercial real estate listing service online with more than 5 million registered members and 2 million average monthly unique visitors. LoopNet offers a suite of products and services tailored to the national and local needs of the commercial real estate industry and its members can list, search, market and research commercial real estate properties over the Internet - reducing their marketing costs, expanding their reach, accelerating the pace of transactions and enhancing their insights on the market.

Requirements:

  • Proficient and highly productive with C#, ASP.NET, JavaScript, JSON, SQL Server, all versions of .NET Framework, XML, Web Services and Visual Studio Team System.
  • 5+ years of experience with internet UI software development (HTML, DHTML, CSS, etc.)
  • Experience with mission critical, high volume (i.e. 500k + hits a day), web-based systems preferred
  • Strong computer system analysis and design skills in current methodologies including object oriented programming
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Ability to prioritize and multi-task while working well with a team
  • Experience in Ajax, jQuery, Angular, or C++ are a plus
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • BS degree in computer science or related field

LoopNet strives to be progressive and innovative in and invests generously in employee benefits, development, and training. LoopNet’s benefits are in the top 10% of benefit providers in the country.  Come join our growing team!

desc:
Job Description

We are currently looking for a motivated, ambitious, dynamic team player to fill the position of IT Infrastructure/Network Administrator. Reporting to the Director, Product Delivery and Support, the successful candidate will be responsible for maintenance and administration of the Montrium IT infrastructure.

The candidate’s main responsibilities will be:

  • Administer, support and maintain Montrium’s IT network infrastructure
  • Manage IT infrastructure security including firewall configuration and physical data center location(s)
  • Manage public domain names and associated external DNS zones (ex: Domain registrations, renewals, DNS changes, DNS zone additions, External DNS related issues and troubleshooting
  • VPN Management, including monitoring and intrusion detection
  • Disaster Recovery /Business Continuity Planning: develop DRP/BCP for data center hosted deployments and assist with disaster recovery testing
  • Provide IT support as required to internal and external end users (ex: password change, laptop, printer …)
  • Manage Montrium’s Cloud-based Azure infrastructure
  • Active directory administration and support
  • Oversee IT Infrastructure Monitoring and Performance management (ex: availability, bandwidth graphs …)
  • Manage Infrastructure change controls (ex: configuration changes), including impact assessments
  • Act as communication liaison with external data center and network provider(s)
  • Manage vendor IT support contracts (ex: SLAs)
  • Provide periodic reports on IT related asks (ex: backup, maintenance)
  • Develop and maintain Standard Operating Procedures

title: Community Manager
skills:
You have experience managing technical, open source based communities and you have a technical background which allows you to engage credibly with our community. 

You are a high energy team player who is driven with a can-do attitude, and you have the ability to articulate the use cases for automation of IT-automation on-premise and in the cloud. You have experience consuming, evangelizing or delivering enterprise software solutions, excellent written and verbal communication skills, strong interpersonal presence with the ability to educate, persuade and influence others and you have experience (or a strong desire to) participate as a speaker, exhibitor and presenter which will make you thrive at events relevant to the CFEngine community. Other desired skills include:

  • Ability to develop and maintain relationships within complimentary open source projects, user organizations and users
  • Ideally, experienced and reputed as an active participant in open source projects with ability to lead significant portions of the project
  • Community interaction skills – Proactive; clear and open in sharing information and ideas; asks, listens and uses feedback and input
  • Blogging and tweeting (with established personal followership)

In addition, any of the below skills would be a great plus:

  • System administration of Linux systems, preferably large-scale
  • Familiarity with at least a few of the following virtualization technologies (ESXi, Xen Project, Xen KVM etc) and OpenStack
  • Extensive knowledge and familiarity (including use) of CFEngine technology
  • Good understanding and exposure to open source development practices and communities
  • Training users within a technical environment
  • Provide technical assistance to users through online channels  and other social media (Q&A systems, forums, mailing lists, blogs and IRC)
  • Good familiarity with DevOps practices and tools
desc:
Job Description

CFEngine is looking for a seasoned technical community manager to develop and implement our community strategy.  This role coordinates with product development and product marketing teams in supporting their respective missions, ensuring consistency in voice and articulating the same in developing a strong community of users and contributors to CFEngine technology.

The ideal candidate will facilitate developer relations and encourage code and content contributions from the community.  This will include being a liaison between developers and facilitating participation in upstream Linux/Unix distributions, cloud orchestrator projects, etc.  The ideal candidate has a strong understanding of how open source communities function and operate.

 Responsibilities Include:

  • Responsible and accountable for developing and nurturing a vibrate CFEngine community of users and developers
  • Provide education and support to CFEngine users via product demonstrations, live and web training
  • Evangelize relevant open source projects through in-person events and on-line communications such as blogs, wiki articles, discussion forums, code samples, newsletters, webinars and IRC
  • Speak at key events worldwide, and publish thought leading commentaries and opinions
  • Responsible for user facing programs (meetups, user groups, CFE vendor and solutions directory)
  • Manage and report on community performance through suitable metric measurements
  • Develop and establish a CFEngine Community conference

desc:
Job Description

About The Team

The Network Administration Team is an advanced team, with the skillset to support the continuously expanding IntraLinks environment. The team will be based out of the Charlestown, MA office with additional staffing in New York, London, and Asia Pacific. The team will build relationships to work in a collaboration environment with the Technical Support, Operations Engineering, Development and Architecture teams.

As a Network Administrator, you will be responsible for the overall health and maintenance of the Internal/External network components and the troubleshooting of environment-related problems through analyzing, testing and evaluating the LAN infrastructure.

Specific responsibilities include:

  • Maintain, document, and enforce industry and company standards.
  • Maintain and configure all Netscaler and F5 Load Balancers
  • Secure Cisco/Juniper network system by enforcing and defining policies, as well as monitoring, modifying and controlling access.
  • Work with 3rd parties to ensure proper configuration and standards
  • Report network operational status by gathering, prioritizing information; managing projects and deadlines.
  • Off hours work sometimes required and possible travel to remote locations.
  • Rotational On-Call support.

about:
YinzCam is the official vendor for the mobile apps of over 55 NFL/NHL/NBA/MLS teams and venues in the United States, with 9M+ downloads of its existing sports team apps. Our apps are constantly in the top 10-25 in the iTunes Free Sports Apps list on game-days, and our apps are rated 4-5 stars. We do all of our design and development in-house, and our philosophy is to put the fan first in all that we do.

We spun off from Carnegie Mellon University in 2009, and we constantly seek to push the envelope in terms of the fan experience and mobile development. We have several technical innovations and "firsts" to our credit, notably, being the first company to deliver instant replays, the NFL RedZone channel and different live streaming camera angles to fans' smartphones inside stadiums, allowing fans to experience the action in a unique, close-up way. 

YinzCam was a finalist for the 2013 Sports Business Journal's Best in Sports Technology Award, was on Network World's list of Top 10 Sports Technologies in 2009, and won ad:tech's 2011 award for best startup in next-generation mobile advertising. We were designated by the National Football League as an Official NFL Handheld Technology Provider. We have been covered widely in the national press, including in the Sports Business Journal, USA Today, Network World, Computer World, New York Times, etc. Pittsburgh Magazine listed YinzCam as one of the top 15 companies to work for, in the region. 

In the news recently:

desc:
Job Description

We are the leading mobile developer for sports teams in the United States. We are experiencing a period of significant growth in our business, and are looking to add more full-time Android developers. 

You will have the opportunity to work in a team of highly-skilled and experienced mobile developers, to work closely with designers, to innovate with new features (such as augmented reality, gaming, etc.), to interface with databases and official league/team statistics and editorial-content feeds, to interface with third-party SDKs and plug-ins, and more. You will have the opportunity to build and launch mobile apps that will be promoted by sports teams/stadiums as their OFFICIAL mobile app, and that will, therefore, be in the hands of millions of fans around the world. 

Perks

You will have the opportunity to travel to stadiums/arenas around the country (and potentially overseas) to see how sports technology works behind the scenes. You will be exposed to the sports industry and all aspects of the company's business, including licensing, sales, advertising, revenue generation, etc. You will work in a company that invests significantly in the training of its personnel, with staff being routinely encouraged to attend professional-development and training conferences to hone and extend their skills. Most of all, you will own equity in a company that has seen rapid growth in its client and user base.  Benefits include competitive salaries and medical+dental insurance. 

Why are we hiring?

We are currently expanding rapidly to take on even more clients, more teams/stadiums and more sports, including soccer, rugby and live concerts overseas, and we are looking to grow our mobile team by adding full-time mobile developers to meet the demand for our products, and to bring even more innovations and features to our existing mobile offerings. Our company affords a close-knit entrepreneurial environment with every individual being exposed to, and having a tangible impact on, the company's business. 

Come join us, and you will be a part of developing the ultimate mobile experience for sports fans everywhere!

Who we want

Curiosity, tenacity, and self-motivation are a must. If we point you in the general direction of a problem, we need you to find the right questions to ask of the right people to get 'er done.

about: NewsCred is the world’s leading syndication platform for high quality journalism.  Our mission is to build the conduit through which every piece of journalistic content in the world flows.  We're doing this by reinventing the way content is distributed, consumed, and shared across the social web.  Along the way, we're breathing new life into the news industry, an institution with fundamental importance to our lives.
title: Software Engineer
skills:
About You

You love creating software so much that it’s disconcerting to your family and friends.  You’re an expert in your favorite technologies. You find few things as satisfying as reading and writing beautiful code. You want to push some code on your first day. You’re irresistibly curious about the latest emerging technologies.  You may or may not have a computer science degree.
desc:
Job Description

The Company

NewsCred is the world’s leading syndication platform for high quality journalism.  Our mission is to build the conduit through which every piece of journalistic content in the world flows.  We're doing this by reinventing the way content is distributed, consumed, and shared across the social web.  Along the way, we're breathing new life into the news industry, an institution with fundamental importance to our lives.

The Work

NewsCred was founded by three engineers; our commitment to pushing the technology envelope is encoded in our DNA.  Whether you're:

  • improving our search infrastructure using the latest techniques in information retrieval and natural language processing, or
  • analyzing terabytes of usage logs to discover what content performs best for our customers, or
  • building a revolutionary content consumption UX,

you'll get to pick the best tools for the job.  We encounter unprecedented challenges everyday.  You’ll be the architect and implementer of the solution.

The Stack


We’re not dogmatic about specific technologies but here’s a list of some of the stuff we’re using:

  • Python
  • Solr
  • Django
  • Backbone.js
  • MySQL
  • MongoDB
  • Puppet

The Team

The engineering team at NewsCred consists of some of the most brilliant, considerate, and fun-loving people you’ll ever meet.  We’re really diligent about who we hire so we can be sure that everyone has a great shot at being both successful and happy.

We organize ourselves into small, autonomous teams that are as self-sufficient and independent as possible.  This allows us to maintain our scrappy, entrepreneurial culture as we grow.

The Perks

  • Competitive salary
  • Insurance - medical, vision, and dental
  • Free monthly metro cards
  • Awesome office in the Flatiron District of Manhattan
  • Happy hours on Thursday
  • Free lunch on Fridays
  • Outings with the team - karaoke, bowling, funky formal, kickball team
  • Simple vacation policy: “Be reasonable”

If you feel like you’re an energetic, open-mined self-starting developer; we’d love to have you on the team.

    But you don’t stop there. No! You’re a software engineer, and you also have the preferred qualifications of:

  • Understanding of Test Driven Development

desc:
Job Description

Level Up Development is small but mighty, and our mightiness comes from the work we do with cutting edge technology. Level Up Development builds applications for the web and mobile devices, but this space is a vast place. To really conquer it, you need ideas that encompass every area of computer science. You have to understand the intricacies of information retrieval, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, user interface design, and the list keeps going.

But for you, all that is nothing. You’re a Software Engineer. You wake up and solve complex problems for breakfast, just because you can, and that really gets you going. Don’t even get you started on the kinds of problems you’re solving by lunch. You can handle any kind of project with any kind of responsibility that’s thrown at you.

NOTE: Local Applicants Only

about:
What we do and who we are:

Each weekday, InsideHook publishes a single compelling story about a unique local experience, helping the man with limited time to live life to the fullest. InsideHook currently publishes four city editions (New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, and Chicago) and an edition that covers the nation. Aly Racer, former president of Penske Media, runs the company. Prior to Penske, Aly served as chief advertising officer for Newsweek. Prior to that, Aly was the VP of Sales at Daily Candy, where she helped lead the company to a successful sale to Comcast. InsideHook is the first portfolio company of Trigger Media Group, which was founded by former Pilot Group partner Andy Russell, the lead investor behind Daily Candy, Thrillist, Tasting Table and Pure Wow.

about:
Bayshore Solutions is an Internet marketing firm with offices in Tampa, Denver and South Florida.   We're a team of 60 and have no plans on stopping our growth.    We've been honored with plenty of awards - Top US Interactive Agencies (Advertising Age), Top 20 Interactive Agencies (B to B Magazine), US Chamber of Commerce Regional Small Business of the Year, Tampa Bay Chamber of Commerce Small Business of the Year.  Help us take down a few more.

Perks & Benefits - We believe in a fun, team oriented culture and we want to meet other like-minded digital experts who enjoy working in a team environment. We offer employee health care coverage, dental insurance, 401 (k), company bonus program, employee-of-the-month parking, employee referral program, free covered parking, monthly lunch & learn and “Town Hall” meetings, creative casual dress code, recreational game area, beautiful new offices with insane views of the Rockies, a Health & Wellness committee, Fun Committee and more.  We're situated on the Walnut Creek trail in between Boulder and Denver.

 ___________________________________________________________________

Want to get an idea of what it’s like to be a developer at Bayshore Solutions?  One of our senior developers contributed this blog on Linkedin in April.  Here is what he said:

  • Development Makes an Impact: Having worked in organizations where software development teams are under pressure to produce measurements to prove that they are adding value instead of being intrinsically valued as the “inventory” of expertise, it’s refreshing to work in a firm where development is perceived as an asset – not another “cost center.” Our skills are engaged directly with the goals of the business, providing value and positively impacting the bottom line.
  • Everyone’s Input Matters: During new web development, I discuss my solution approach with my team members and project managers. Frequently, I am asked to provide insight on the best approach in the development of a solution. As an employee, this conveys that my expertise is highly valued and respected. This encourages me to continually strive for efficiency and creativity in my solutions.
  • Utilization of New Technologies: In my 19 years as developer, the one thing that has remained constant is the need to keep abreast of new technologies and methods. In the past six months, tools like Kendo UI and Sitefinity CMS have been introduced along with training in topics such as MVC and Jquery. Every Thursday, the development team comes together to either train or share new development practices. Learning is an important part of our development path.
  • Success is Shared: Bayshore Solutions provides opportunities in monthly Town Hall meetings to discuss all aspects of the company’s inner workings. Discussions can range from the projected financial goals and tracking of actual results to the items that the employees would like to see included in the vending machines. It seems my idea of adding Pork Rinds didn’t make the cut. There’s always next month…
  • Fun: I chose my profession because it challenges me and gives me a sense of accomplishment when I implement a creative solution. I enjoy what I do. Bayshore provides a professional, yet fun-loving atmosphere that creates the perfect balance of work and play. All work and no plush-cat-bowling would make for a very dull day. Feel free to stop by my desk anytime – the plush-cats are set up and ready.

title: Team Lead - Software Engineering
skills:
About You

You love creating software so much that it’s disconcerting to your family and friends.  You’re an expert in your favorite technologies. You find few things as satisfying as reading and writing beautiful code. You want to push some code on your first day. You’re irresistibly curious about the latest emerging technologies.  You may or may not have a computer science degree.
desc:
Job Description

The Company

NewsCred is the world’s leading syndication platform for high quality journalism.  Our mission is to build the conduit through which every piece of journalistic content in the world flows.  We're doing this by reinventing the way content is distributed, consumed, and shared across the social web.  Along the way, we're breathing new life into the news industry, an institution with fundamental importance to our lives.

The Work

NewsCred was founded by three engineers; our commitment to pushing the technology envelope is encoded in our DNA.  Whether you're:

  • improving our search infrastructure using the latest techniques in information retrieval and natural language processing, or
  • analyzing terabytes of usage logs to discover what content performs best for our customers, or
  • building a revolutionary content consumption UX,

you'll get to pick the best tools for the job.  We encounter unprecedented challenges everyday.  You’ll be the architect and implementer of the solution.

The Stack


We’re not dogmatic about specific technologies but here’s a list of some of the stuff we’re using:

  • Python
  • Solr
  • Django
  • Backbone.js
  • MySQL
  • MongoDB
  • Puppet

The Team

The engineering team at NewsCred consists of some of the most brilliant, considerate, and fun-loving people you’ll ever meet.  We’re really diligent about who we hire so we can be sure that everyone has a great shot at being both successful and happy.

We organize ourselves into small, autonomous teams that are as self-sufficient and independent as possible.  This allows us to maintain our scrappy, entrepreneurial culture as we grow.

The Perks

  • Competitive salary
  • Insurance - medical, vision, and dental
  • Free monthly metro cards
  • Awesome office in the Flatiron District of Manhattan
  • Happy hours on Thursday
  • Free lunch on Fridays
  • Outings with the team - karaoke, bowling, funky formal, kickball team
  • Simple vacation policy: “Be reasonable”

about:
We’re Buuna, a startup mobile agency located in Sydney CBD.  We’ve been doing agency work for the last two years, and our focus is high quality, strategic mobile solutions for corporate, enterprise and agency clients (take a look at our website!) We don’t do small personal projects, only global brand and recognisable corporates with a sizable marketing budget, so all our projects are exciting, brand-recognizable, and have immense marketing consequences for our clients.

We pride ourselves as geeks running a technical agency – our engineers are some of the best in Australia, and while we’re established mobile experts, we’re always on the lookout for fun cutting-edge projects as well, such as Google Glass, touch screens/displays, and wearable computing devices.

WHY US?

We offer you not just a job, but a home and a future that you can own and grow with for the rest of your life. If you can handle the responsibility and hard work, you’ll be able to share the reward as we grow and expand your team further, so you’ll have something that will not only pay the bills, but something that you can be proud of and own for the rest of your life.

Culturally, we love what we do, and we work hard and play hard – we have a great team of some of the best strategists, salespeople, designers and engineers in the country, and everyone is equally motivated and driven to success as you are. Our Sydney CBD office has a great startup vibe with a lot of video games, alcohol in the fridge, and Rubicks cubes, so when the work is done, we can all relax and have a great time!
title: CTO – Startup Mobile Agency
skills:
• Agency experience – We need someone that understands how the development lifecycle and engineering processes work in the context of an agency setup, so you’ll need to have worked at a reputable Marketing/Web/Advertising agency before
  • Intelligence– We need someone smart.  Can you confidently present yourself as the smartest person in the room, and back it up with your technical knowledge, reasoning and understanding?
  • Technical background – Have you ever worked as a developer?  You must be a technical person that understands software (C/C++/Java/Objective-C) and computer science, who is able to lead the engineering team by example and from the front; no pure management background CTOs for us!
  • Some management experience – You must have led an engineering team before.  It doesn’t matter to us whether that team is two people, three people or thirty – it matters that you understand how to motivate people, get them following good industry standard engineering process, and produce good quality code.
  • Charismatic and fun personality, with loads of enthusiasm – We’re a fun company working in a fun and exciting space, so you need to be a CTO that’s representative of our brand and can get our team and clients excited about our services and products, as you’ll be involved in the sales/relationship process.
  • Ambitious, gets stuff done, not afraid to get hands dirty personality – At the end of the day, we’re a startup, and you should only apply if you want to build your career with your own hands, not if you want a standard 9-5 job with strict boundaries and clearly defined roles/responsibilities/hours.  A startup is very rewarding, but you need to make it happen yourself!

desc:
Job Description

Have you ever wanted to be part of a startup? Know that you have enough experience, intelligence and charisma to take charge of your career and build something that you will be proud of, but the opportunity just never came up?

If so, then that opportunity is here! We’re a growing, successful startup, and we’re looking for a CTO with ambition and vision to join us to help shape and grow our business!

ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITES

It’s your standard startup CTO job (if there is a “standard”?), where you’re the number one go-to person for everything technical and code related.  You’ll be involved in every aspect of the business, from planning to hiring to the management of the engineering team.  You’ll be out meeting clients with the BDMs and the CEO, quoting and planning for new projects, and then making sure they’re done on time and on budget.  And of course, if any code related issues arise, then you’ll need to help the engineering team resolve it through your superior technical skills.

APPLICATIONS

This is a job about fit – we’ll be choosing our interview candidates based on the criteria below.  We need a technical leader that’s going to settle into this job long term, treat this business as if it’s their own, and be ambitious in trying to grow this company to be the biggest and best if its kind in Australia. 

Sounds like a job for you?  Please apply by writing a convincing cover letter to jobs@buuna.com to explain why you want this job, along with your resume. 

Note that we treat the intelligence and technical background criteria quite highly, as we pride ourselves on hiring the best and smartest engineers in Australia, so you will be required to do a technical test at some point in your interview (if you can’t pass, the engineers won’t respect you!)

US/European applicants looking to do the startup lifestyle in sunny Sydney are welcome to apply!

about:
Why work for Trulia?

Engineering gets respect.  

We use the phrase "we're a tech company that does Real Estate" to emphasize how important engineering is to the company.  Engineering is the team that drives our apps, tools, data, and interfaces forward.   This attitude comes not only from engineers, but from our CEO and other top management. They believe in us.

Innovation happens every day.  http://youtu.be/YJHsr2ep1cw

Trulia is focused on creating the very best technology in the industry.  We don’t just talk about innovation; we actually dedicate time to work the magic.  Engineers get to build the products they want to build.  We need your ideas to keep it going. 

Stability is wonderful.  
We're that rare company that holds the culture of its startup roots, while blending in the sanity of a regular work schedule with an emphasis on work/life/family balance. It’s like this because we worked hard to make it this way.

Other Perks:
- 'Innovation Week' every quarter
- People you're happy to see every day
- Stocked Kitchens and multiple kegerators
- Unbeatable SOMA location with penthouse roof deck
- All IDEs welcome
- Aeron chairs
- Great benefits (untracked time off, variety of health plans, 401k match)

Trulia is a successful rapidly growing technology company, redefining the home search experience for consumers and changing the way real estate professionals build their businesses. Our marketplace, delivered through the web and mobile applications, gives consumers powerful tools to research homes and neighborhoods and enables real estate professionals to efficiently market their listings and attract new clients.

Trulia was founded in 2005, backed by Accel Partners and Sequoia Capital, and had a successful IPO in 2012.  We are headquartered in downtown San Francisco with offices in Denver and New York and voted Best Place to Work in both San Francisco and Denver.

desc:
Job Description

What you’ll work on:

-       You’ll serve as technical lead for Trulia’s Communications team that sends millions of messages to millions of users every week via emails and mobile push notifications.

-       You’ll contribute to Trulia’s awesome, employee-centric team, managing the team of developers who work on the communications platform and email teams, and mentoring developers across both teams.

-       You’ll join forces with other engineering leads to achieve great things, including platform scaling projects, bottom-up performance changes, enumerating and prioritizing engineering goals, and more.

What you'll work with:

Our communications platform is build in Java/PHP/MySQL and our base web stack is LAMP, but that rides on top of Solr/Lucene, Hadoop, Memcache, Python, Couchbase, Open Street Maps, and more.  On the client-side, we use jQuery for its simplicity, and JS libraries like d3.js, Raphael.js, and Google’s JS Maps API to make awesome products. We're learning OOCSS and are folding SASS into our workflow as well. We use Git, and are nurturing a code review culture. If there's something that's a good idea for the team, we'll do our best to implement it.
 
How we work:

The engineering team is about 150 people. We break into small teams of 2-4 to focus on specific projects, working closely with product managers and designers when appropriate. We release weekly, but new features are always under development and often span releases. Our local and remote QA teams write automated tests, and do hand testing of our products, working with us to ensure that only high quality code gets to production. Organizationally, we're pretty flat, though you'll have a mentor with whom you'll have weekly 1-on-1 meetings, to review code, exchange ideas, and ensure we're doing everything we can for you to thrive in your role.

The Data Science Team at XING offers an open position for a 
Senior Software Test Engineer (m/f)
focused on testing REST services created on top of our infrastructure stack (e.g., ElasticSearch, Hadoop, etc.).

Our crossfunctional Data Science team is responsible for turning data into services within the company. 15 Data scientists, architects and developers work together to create highly scalable solutions to serve our more than 13 million users. We work with the latest technologies in an international environment (our team has people from 9 different nationalities) and with challenging goals, that we pursue with passion and a lot of fun.

A challenging task:

As a software quality and test expert you are the quality conscience of Data Science Team. During sprint planning, you discover the true complexity behind the product manager's ideas. During development, you design and write automated test cases for the data services of the team (e.g., search, recommendations, network inference calls, etc.). When you find ambiguities, you confer with the product manager to ensure the team is heading towards the right direction. You execute the tests and you are responsible for the defect management. You inspire the developers to deliver a high quality product. Afterwards, you discover those critical bugs that only a professional tester can find.

Our team is looking for a motivated and experienced QA engineer who wants to work with the latest technologies in an international environment (our team has people from 9 different nationalities!) and with extremely challenging goals.

At InterExchange, we believe that living and working alongside people in another country increases global understanding. We are dedicated to providing the best exchange experiences possible – and to creating positive global impact in the process.

desc:
Job Description

In the Enterprise world spreadsheets are everything. They love them, use them every day and whisper sweet nothings to them at night. The problem is that over time when dealing with a large number of users and lots of Excel files, Excel becomes unmanageable, inefficient and eventually 'Excel Hell' takes over.

What invariably ends up happening is a big old-guard player comes in and convinces the company to get rid of Excel, getting them to use an Excel 'look and feel'. This story has played out over and over again - the customer buys the solution, ends up hating it and eventually moves back to using Excel.

At Vena we're coming at it from an entirely different angle: embrace your spreadsheets and marry them with an incredibly elegant web-based process designer and the Vena in-memory OLAP cube!

We're a well funded company in full entrepreneurial growth mode looking to hire the best. If you want to work on something that great companies like McDonalds and Wells Fargo actually use then look no further than Vena Solutions.

About the role

We're looking for strong software engineers to join our engineering team in Toronto to help us scale and build out our C# .NET Office application. Our VSTO application is built on the shoulders of giants using:

  • C# .NET
  • Excel Interop/VBA
  • LINQ
  • Lambda Functions
  • JSON-based Web Services
  • Parallelization

To learn more about Vena visit our StackOverflow Company page: http://careers.stackoverflow.com/company/vena

desc:
Job Description

Yes, you'll get business cards that read "Growth Hacker"

We're looking for a developer to lead a new and interesting project at Zipwhip.

The position will be a full time addition to the engineering team and after the project is completed will transition to other projects of interest. At Zipwhip, we wear many different hats. 

This project will be an internal tool that will automate many aspects of the direct sales process. It will help the sales team decide what to say to which companies. Ultimately, it will help manage our call centers by determining where they should spend their time for greatest effect.

We're going to load up all the data we can find on companies in the US into Hadoop and then run jobs on the data to output the best next move. It's kind of like dating. Is 3 days too soon to call? Should we compliment them on their big announcement, or is that inappropriate for the 2nd email? Your app will tell us.

The tool will also automate communication with those companies. For example, let's say that it sends out an email introducing a salesperson. 3 days later that salesperson should be told to call them - the tool will even create a custom script for them to read out loud. After they sign up, it should send automated texts to that number asking them if they've tried out [feature X].

Though you won't save baby seals, the project spans many cool technologies. 

  • We'll mine the data from any number of disparate sources and normalize it into Hadoop (or Cassandra).

  • Twitter bootstrap/jquery UI so the sales guy can send unreasonable requests to your backend.

  • Spring/Java processor (and maybe even Twitter Storm) to process the requests asynchronously (they might take hours to finish)

Kind of like Siri for sales guys. This thing will print money. For sure.

about:
Here at iParadigms we make software to help educators be more productive and keep students honest in their work. Our flagship web application, Turnitin, is a completely paperless way for written work to be submitted, verified for authenticity, and graded online.  Using our tools, teachers can markup papers, grade, and even leave audio feedback on student work. Soon, the same tools and more will be at their fingertips on the iPad. It’s not hard to understand why teachers, instructors, and college professors love our products – we help them connect with their students in new, innovative ways, while helping them to be more productive with their time and improve the overall educational experience.

Why should you work here?

The Technology: Turnitin is on the cutting edge of both Big Data and Data Visualization. We process several hundred thousand student papers a day in a fourteen languages, employing a host of techniques to scale and deliver results around the world. On the front end, we employ the very latest javascript and HTML5 technologies to create rich and seamless web UIs - and we're rapidly expanding on mobile devices as well. We're a very collaborative, team-oriented culture that is always looking for top-notch pros who want to engage with some of the toughest and most interesting problems in computer science.

The People: We pride ourselves on having a friendly, open, humble, and diverse culture.  We have about 100 people at our headquarters in downtown Oakland and about 40 across North America and the UK; everyone has a chance to get to know one another. We collaborate. We innovate. We share.

The Business: Turnitin is the market leader in anti-plagiarism and online grading by almost every measure. It is used by more than 1 million instructors at 10,000+ institutions in over 110 countries serving 20+ million students in 14 languages. We have processed more than a quarter billion student papers with our software.

Our customers love us, we love them, and we keep winning new ones every month across the globe. In addition to Turnitin, we’ve created iThenticate for researchers and publishers, WriteCheck for students, and Turnitin for Admissions for admissions professionals. 

Our numbers are not public, but we are profitable and have been for several years. iParadigms is a part of the Warburg Pincus family of companies.

Cool Perks: Generous Personal Time Off. Generous 401K match that is 100% vested at contribution. Paid time away to volunteer in your community, and matching charity contribution up to $2500 annually. Chair massages. Subsidized gym membership. Great location at 12th Street BART just blocks from Chinatown, Lake Merritt, Jack London Square, and the Fox and Paramount theatres.

title: Senior Software Developer
skills:
We'd love to hear from you if:

  • You understand software. Maybe you have a university degree to prove it; maybe you learned in the trenches. Ideally, both.
  • You've shipped code that real users have had to rely on
  • You have the ability to emit your thoughts using a small number of short, preferably English, words strung together in a logical manner.
  • You're someone we'd willingly sit next to on an airplane

In exchange for your passion and expertise, we offer:

  • a competitive salary, full benefits, stock options, and vacation time that we will not try to talk you out of using
  • flexible hours and a location in downtown Toronto
  • powerful code-making machinery
  • access to a variety of stimulants and depressants, where legal and appropriate

We do not want to hear from you if:

  • The last time you used JavaScript was that falling snowflake script you found in 2002
  • You tend to write emails that begin with "dear sirs"

Sounds good? If so, here are some things that you might want to send our way:

  • samples of your code or work
  • a short, concise resume or summary of what you've done with your life so far

desc:
Job Description

ShopLocket is the fastest way to add ecommerce functionality to any web site, whether that's adding a simple shopping cart or taking preorders and charging later. Our platform is powering some of the hottest new products on the web. On the surface, what we've built is simple, but don't let that fool you: countless engineering challenges lurk beneath and we have more than enough product and scaling challenges to keep the neurons firing.

That’s where you come in. We're looking for a few ambitious and talented developers to join us and help build the next versions of ShopLocket. We're a small team and we're looking forward to the impact of people who brings experience, technical prowess, and fresh product ideas.

At ShopLocket, we're currently spending a lot of time on:

  • building a product that can live anywhere through the magic of third-party Javascript
  • turning our simple service into an API that other developers can build on top of
  • designing a tool that gets out of the way when it has to but be intuitive and pleasant to use when it can't
  • investing in automated testing so that we can adapt our codebase without (too much) stress and deploy confidently
  • giving ourselves a quantified view into how both buyers and sellers use our platform

We're looking for:

  • VP Engineering
  • Senior Front-end Developer
  • Senior Back-end Developer

Please note: ShopLocket is not looking for recruitment agencies to help fill this position.

Trulia is a successful rapidly growing technology company, redefining the home search experience for consumers and changing the way real estate professionals build their businesses. Our marketplace, delivered through the web and mobile applications, gives consumers powerful tools to research homes and neighborhoods and enables real estate professionals to efficiently market their listings and attract new clients.

title: Android Developer
skills:
You:
- You have worked in a professional coding environment for over 3 years

- You've been working directly on Android for at least 1 year

- You have strong object-oriented programming and architecture skills

- You live to break down and solving complex problems by creating practical, maintainable, and scalable solutions

- You enjoy working with talented engineers, and craving an environment where you can learn from others and share your knowledge

- You’ve demonstrated success innovating with Engineering, Product and Design teams

- You're a great person that willingly collaborates, listens, and cares about treating people fairly.

- Your work commands a top ranking in Google Play
 

What you'll work with:

We currently have 3 top rated apps in Google Play and 2 for Kindle Fire. We use the standard Android framework with ActionBarSherlock and Android support library for UI consistency and device accessibility. We start with great user experience, ensure app stability, and focus on performance and code readability. We use ANT with Jenkins for our continuous integration. We release frequently and are working with Robolectric and Android uiautomator for testing. We use Git, and are nurturing a code review culture. We are always looking for new performance tools and optimization techniques to enhance our apps. If there's something that's a good idea for the team, we'll do our best to implement it.
desc:
Job Description

What you’ll work on:
- You’ll be part of the team responsible for all of Trulia’s Android application development. This includes top rated phone and tablet apps featured on Google Play and even a few apps for Kindle. These apps are used by millions of consumers and real estate professionals each day, so the work you do will have huge impact.

- You’ll contribute to Trulia’s awesome, employee-centric team, participating in stand-ups, weekly planning meetings and collaborating with our product and design team.

- You’ll join forces with other Android developers to achieve great things, including implementing new features, optimizing performance, and learning new things about Android.

How we work:

The engineering team is about a hundred people, and we break into small teams of 2-4 to focus on specific projects. We release often, with new features always under development and a strong focus on user experience. Our local QA team writes automation tests and does hand testing of your features, working with you to ensure that only high quality code gets to production. Organizationally, we're pretty flat, though you'll have a mentor with whom you'll have weekly 1-on-1 meetings, to review code, exchange ideas, and ensure we're doing everything we can for you to thrive in your role.

Why work at Trulia?

Engineering gets respect.  
We use the phrase 'we're a tech company that does Real Estate' to emphasize how important engineering is to the company.  Engineering is the department that drives our apps, tools, data, and interfaces forward. This attitude comes not only from the Engineers, but from our CEO and other top management. They believe in us.
 
We have awesome problems to solve.  
The housing market provides a fantastic blend of problems.  We need creative people to help us combine the data about every address in America with the soft side of helping people find a home that makes them feel safe, happy, and comfortable.
 
Stability is wonderful.  
We're that rare company that holds the culture of its startup roots, while blending in the sanity of a regular work schedule with an emphasis on work/life/family balance. It’s like this because we worked hard to make it this way.

At ZenPayroll, you will:

  • Work with our product team to understand customer pain points, come up with solutions, and then prototype, iterate, and launch frequently what you've made.
  • Be surrounded by individuals doing the best work of their lives, and loving every moment of it.

title: Full stack developer with YC startup
desc:
YCombinator-backed music startup bop.fm seeking full stack developers to join founding team.

What we do
bop.fm (Ycombinator S'13) creates a home for every song on the internet. We are a Bay Area music technology company that aggregates several popular music services (Spotify, Rdio, iTunes, YouTube, SoundCloud, etc) into one app. You can then search for any song, play it using any service, and share/discover with any friend (even if they use a different service than you). bop.fm powers this same aggregation and service-agnostic music playback for content publishers, messaging clients, social networks, wireless carriers, garden gnomes, etc. For more info, please see our recent coverage in Fast Company.

What you'll do
• Build a sweet music service even your grandma can use
• Develop features/applications, including collaboration on defining requirements, prototyping, design, coding, testing and deployment
• Implement robust, highly scalable (we already get tens of millions of pageviews), highly optimized backend components
• Evaluate and integrate latest technologies and third party libraries/APIs
• Contribute to design, code, specification and architectural reviews and technical documentation

Who we are
The founders are startup veterans who were early employees at KAYAK.com (acquired by Priceline), BillShrink (acquired by MasterCard), and Color (acquired by Apple). They have worked on 11 different search engine verticals, and music is now their 12th.

Who you are
• Full-stack software engineer with 5+ years experience (or are good enough to fake it)
• Fun to work with (i.e., you're Jay Z, not Kanye)
• Passionate about music
• Past startup experience++
• Mobile development skills+++

What we use
• Ruby on Rails
• Redis
• Red Bull
• MongoDB
• HTML5/CSS3/Custom JavaScript
• Heroku

How to apply
Email shehzad@bop.fm (no recruiters/agencies please) with:
• Resume / LinkedIn profile / GitHub profile
• How you heard of us
• A couple of your favorite songs/artists and why (yes, you will be judged)

desc:
Job Description

We are seeking an experienced senior product manager who can help us continue development of our educational technology platform.

The Position

We need an exceptional product manager to help enhance Gaggle's web and mobile tools designed for K-12 schools. This is a full-time position where you'll work from home and the hours are flexible.

You will be joining an existing team of developers, system administrators and QA folks who also work remotely.

What You'll Be Doing

  • Surveying the marketplace to identify opportunities for enhancements and completely new product extensions
  • Interviewing customers to understand their needs and required features
  • Researching competitors to determine market priorities and product positioning
  • Writing functional specifications and requirements
  • Participating in UI decisions and usability analysis
  • Guiding new product initiatives through stages of prototyping, design, development, and implementation.
  • Juggling priorities — we are a fast-moving company and we need a product manager who can move quickly and communicate clearly.

The Technology

Our technology is built using industry standard Java frameworks such as GWT, Struts and Hibernate. Our data is housed on dozens of clustered MySQL databases and our servers are powered by Linux. 

Ready for a Change?

If you're looking for a lifestyle change Gaggle might be the answer:

  • Do you wish you worked on meaningful projects that actually get used?
  • Do you want to help build tools that enhance student learning and protect kids from bullying and dangerous situations?
  • What if you could work from home with flexible hours? - Skip the commute, eat dinner with your family & wake up on your own schedule. 

 Please Only Highly Qualified Candidates

Our technical team is very picky about who we hire.

If you are interested send us a brief note along with your resume.

title: Well-funded Startup Seeks Strong Ruby on Rails Developers
skills:
We're looking for smart coworkers who can handle both independence and teamwork and get excited about building great products.

Specifically, we're looking with someone who has:

  • A solid understanding of the Ruby language and the Rails framework, and at least three years working with it in a professional environment
  • Solid computer science fundamentals
  • Experience with iterative and incremental development (short sprint Agile workflow)
  • Experience writing tests and maintaining test coverage
  • Experience shipping one or more Rails-based, API-driven applications and/or contributing meaningfully to open source projects
  • A good comfort level with HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript
  • Good UX sensibilities
  • Experience with GitHub for version control (what's your GitHub username?)
  • Great communication and collaboration skills with teammates
  • The ability and desire to learn new techniques and technologies
  • The ability and desire to share your knowledge with others (include your StackExchange profile information!)

What You'll Do:

  • Development: Development, and more development. We have a nice clean codebase and data structures, and we are going to keep it that way. Our stack is an Angular.js layer over a Ruby on Rails API, talking to MySQL. We also have some mobile applications in play, so bonus points if you have familiarity with Android or iOS webviews.
  • R&D: In addition to our current products, we're always developing cool new things. You'll be involved in brainstorming, hacking hardware & software, and prototyping. Everyone's voice is important. 
  • Design: We pride ourselves on creating effective and intuitive user experiences, and want you to think about design in terms of the user's workflow in the hospital and how to bring that to the design of data structures, APIs, and even the UI where you can (we have dedicated front-end developers).

There's plenty of room for education and career growth, socializing and idea generation at conferences and trade shows, and interactions with actual & potential customers. We value ongoing learning, too! Although we're a small team right now, we are committed to helping you learn and grow professionally.

Applicants must be local to Washington, DC or willing to relocate (relocation assistance offered), and have immediate work authorization in the U.S.

We're a well-funded healthcare startup developing disruptive technology for our ecstatic customers, and we're putting together an exceptional team of developers. You'll help change the face of hospital technology and be part of a team building the first truly hospital-wide and real-time drug and inventory tracking platform. Whether you're a hacker who lives and breathes data, a seasoned developer who enjoys a rare opportunity to build new products from scratch, or someone passionate about improving healthcare through smart, modern technology, talk to us today.

Although we're primarily a software company, we also have a strategic portfolio of hardware that we design in-house. Since we're a startup, you'll have the ability to create cool technology and see products go to market quickly. Much of what we're creating is brand new, so there's a lot of creativity involved in our day to day operations. Our two co-founders have strong technical backgrounds, appreciate the nuances of that process, and strive to strike the right balance between that and getting marketable, effective products into customers' hands.

Job Description

Stonestreet One, a leading global provider of Bluetooth and WiFi software solutions to leading OEM's and ODM's worldwide, is seeking to fill several positions with experienced and entry level Embedded Software Engineers to develop and test new and existing Bluetooth and WiFi wireless embedded software solutions.  If you lack the wireless experience, but you are a skilled embedded software developer or a recent graduate with the desire to develop embedded software solutions, we will teach you about wireless here at Stonestreet One.

A successful candidate will be a self-motivated, self-starter, who is able to work effectively with a small team of engineers during the software development process.  Strong debugging and problem solving skills, as well as good communication skills (written and verbal) are also a requirement.

Job responsibilities will include developing and maintaining Bluetooth and WiFi software solutions targeted for embedded systems.  A strong work ethic will be required to continually learn (and implement) new technologies that will be utilized for Bluetooth and WiFi offerings.  Additional responsibilities may also include working with Quality Assurance to develop/document test plans and working with the support team to verify and resolve customer reported issues.

We are also searching for engineers with the above skillset, but with a desire to be more involved on the sales side of the business and to be more involved directly with customers.

title: Enterprise Solutions Architect
skills:
Basic Qualifications

This role is typically engaged as the highest-level technology expert on a project team.

  • Partners with business analysts, systems analysts and engineers in requirements gathering and reviews.
  • Responsible for analyzing and translating business, information and technical requirements into an architectural blueprint that outlines solutions to achieve business objectives.
  • Works with enterprise architecture, application and infrastructure teams to produce an optimal, high level, conceptual design for the project.
  • Develops enterprise level solutions that integrate across applications, systems and platforms.
  • Proposes changes in process, policy and standards as they relate to the architecture and design principles.
  • Researches and maintains knowledge in emerging technologies and solutions to solve business problems.
  • Viewed as a technical expert and critical resource across multiple disciplines.
  • Bachelors or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or other related field. Or equivalent work experience.
  • Typically has 5+ years of experience in multiple IT areas and 3+ years of relevant architecture and project management experience.
  • Requires advanced to expert level knowledge and understanding of architecture, application design, systems engineering and integration.

Desired Qualifications

  • Experience working with cross-functional technical teams. The ideal candidate will possess both a technology, business, and architecture background that enables them engage at the CXO level as well as with enterprise customers and sales/field reps. He/she should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions.
desc:
Job Description

Enterprise Solutions Architect

Overview

Enterprise Solutions Architect is able to review current scenario and recommend solutions for future state. This person will be required to code/develop the solution. Enterprise Solutions Architect should have expert development experience and be skilled in cloud technologies, such as Salesforce.com, Workday, Zuora, etc., or able to learn and fill the gap in knowledge in a very short period of time.


About the Team

The Enterprise Solutions Architect reports to the Director of PMO, and is part of the Information Technology team.

Responsibilities

  • Recommend and implement solutions based on best practices, architecture principles and rational sense
  • Design more robust / error proof solutions
  • Implement concise/simple interface for end user friendliness
  • Improve simple query processing to measure metrics and KPIs, vendor and commodity level sourcing risk
  • Support the project portfolio process by defining the high level solution for each opportunity in the portfolio, as well as work with Business Solutions Analysts and technology resources in defining the low-level solution
  • Validate accuracy of the implemented artifacts throughout the project life cycle
  • Provide guidance during support phase to bug/enhancement requirements
  • Support Enterprise Architect in documenting different architecture artifacts pertaining to various architected solutions

title: Scala Developer for Green Building Software
skills:
For designers who aspire to design high performance buildings, Sefaira, founded in 2009, provides the very best web and desktop applications to enable immersive and seamless performance-based design with real-time feedback on the impact of design decisions.

Our Values

At Sefaira, 7 core values drive our work:

  • Learning, Growth & Science
  • Agile & Lean Mindset
  • Empowerment, Judgement & Accountability
  • Teamwork & Respect
  • Clarity & Communication
  • An Aesthetic and Sustainable World
  • Passion

Our Customers

Our software is built for use by architects and designers. As lead designers of the built environment, architects literally shape our world, and they have direct power to influence the sustainability of society through their designs. We empower architects to improve global sustainability in a meaningful way. Sefaira is in use at 170+ architecture firms globally, including 5 of the World Architecture Top 10 firms.

Recognition

Since our inception in 2009, we have won numerous awards for our contribution to the fields of sustainability, technology, and design.

  • Gold Winner - Ecosummit 2013
  • Europe Top 100 - Red Herring 2013
  • Global Top 200 Private Company - GoingGreen 2012
  • Green Building Innovation of the Year Winner - Ecobuild 2011
desc:
The Role

Sefaira is looking for talented software engineers to join us in our effort to build the greatest software for helping architects design buildings with best-of-class sustainability performance.

We are looking for someone with outstanding core skill in programming, program design, and testing, as well as a strong ability to engage in open-minded technical debates. A great candidate will likely have significant expertise programming in some bleeding-edge language (Scala, JavaScript (the Good Parts), Racket, Haskell, etc). We are looking for someone who knows how to push to and monitor code in production (AWS, Heroku), and is excited to learn new techniques, languages and tools (functional programming, MongoDB, Node.js).

Once you arrive at Sefaira, you should be ready to learn about how architects work and how building energy analysis is done. If you have experience developing for the web, great, we will put it to use. Any experience iterating on a customer-facing product will find uses as well.

Though the people with the skill we are looking for are likely to have Computer Science higher-ed degrees, we will consider all applications based on demonstrated coding ability. For instance, we will be happy to take into consideration your online portfolio of open source contributions.

Our team is small and each person is expected to work across the stack. The development team works collaboratively with each other across disciplines, product management, architects and mechanical engineers. The work is iterative and responsive to changing priorities. We strive to go from idea to production fast.

Every member of the team is expected to collaborate with others in the organization, come up with new ideas and promote them within the organization, have high quality standards, and to get stuff shipped to our customers that will change the way they and the industry at large designs buildings.

Benefits

  • Competitive salary
  • Stock options
  • 5 weeks vacation
  • Medical, dental and vision insurance
  • 401k with company match
  • Equipment of your choice
  • Weekly happy hour

Location

This full-time position is based in New York City. We’re located at Union Square.

desc:
Job Description

BrightScope is looking for a highly detailed and hands-on Sr. QA Engineer responsible for working with our development team to drive bug free product releases. You will design and define the QA processes, develop repeatable and automatable QA systems and build out the BrightScope QA team. You will work closely with the CTO and VP of Engineering as well as product managers, client services, data and development to oversee the development of quality standards for QA protocols and how they integrate with product features and technical implementation. You will identify use cases and create test plans, define test strategies and create both manual ad automated test cases in order to report to internal stakeholders on the quality and reliability of our products.  

You will be responsible for:

  • Providing hands-on involvement in all development projects by actively leading reviews of product requirements, design, schedules and test plans
  • Hands-on coding and coordinating the efforts of the QA team members
  • Defining and executing the QA test plan for feature and product releases by performing test planning, manual testing, test automation and verification
  • Establishing QA best practices from project inception to deployment
  • Identifying, reporting  and managing defects through JIRA and tracking through closure
  • Working closely with the development team to assist in the reproduction and resolution of defects
  • Ensuring that the reliability, performance and function of assigned features and functionality meet or exceed business objectives
  • Coordinating with the project teams

This opportunity is for our corporate office in San Diego.

Location: La Jolla/UTC
Compensation: We offer a competitive compensation package (DOE) including medical, dental and vision insurance, paid time off, and company equity.

Qualified candidates should email their resumes and cover letters to jobs@brightscope.com with “SO SR QA Dev” in the subject line. Local/CA candidates strongly preferred. 

BrightScope Equal Opportunity Employment Statement: It is our policy to comply with all applicable state and federal laws prohibiting discrimination in employment. We are an equal opportunity employer. This means that employment decisions are based on merit and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, genetic characteristics, veteran status, caregiver or any other status protected by federal, state or local laws, or on the basis of any perception that an applicant or employee has any of these characteristics or on the basis that an applicant or employee is associated with someone who has perceived to have these characteristics.
