Job Description

Skimbox and SoftArtisans are looking for a talented Operations Engineer with excellent problem-solving and communication skills to join our IT/Technical Operations Team.  The IT Team is responsible for internal IT administration for SoftArtisans, as well as devops for SkimBox. We are looking to add someone who can own parts of the infrastructure and help be responsible for uptime across the environment. While we’re looking for someone skilled, the individual skillset isn’t too important – languages/applications can be learned; what’s most important for us is someone who is proactive, passionate about technology, loves automation, and hates downtime.

What’s the job like?

This is not a typical Systems Admin job.  As an Operations Engineer with SoftArtisans and Skimbox, you will serve as a key resource for troubleshooting and resolving issues. In addition to successful resolution of daily issues for the team, you will be tasked with the design and implementation of IT projects with a high level of autonomy.  This role is ideal for the individual that is looking to take their administration experience to the next level.

title: SENIOR SOFTWARE DESIGN ENGINEER
desc:
Engineers needed to help lead the medical software revolution!

The medical software industry is experiencing a revolution, and pMD is looking for a Senior Software Design Engineer who has the talent and drive to change it forever. You’ll have a huge impact on health care in America by using cutting edge technology to change the way that physicians practice medicine.

A developer’s career at pMD is nothing like the stereotype of a programmer. In addition to brilliant engineering, it involves high-level decision making; interaction with customers who love using our product; involvement in sales, recruiting and other aspects of the business; and rapid career growth through real mentorship.

It’s like a startup in that you’ll wear many hats, have a lot of responsibility and be part of a small, highly motivated team. It’s not like a startup in that we make our own business decisions. We have a proven and profitable product, extremely happy customers and a team of people as talented as you are. We love what we do. We strive to work like a beautifully engineered German car: fast, efficient and fun.

As a Senior Software Design Engineer at pMD, you’re a technical leader in training. You've not only demonstrated engineering excellence, you’ve also been informally building management skills since you were in school by balancing multiple high-priority projects simultaneously. Your past accomplishments suggest that as the company continues to grow, you’re ready to start mentoring others and eventually build and lead a team of developers.

Your programming work will focus on extending our Java/JSP Web application, with an emphasis on open source technologies like Linux, Apache, Tomcat, Struts, AJAX/Web Services and MySQL. You’ll have opportunities to work on sophisticated native apps for Android, iPhone, iPad, and possibly others.

You:

  • bring at least three years of focused, impactful experience as a Web and/or mobile developer… plus a lifetime of curiosity
  • have intelligence, energy and integrity
  • want to grow your career quickly and start learning management skills
  • lead multiple high-priority projects simultaneously
  • design applications that are intuitive and fun to use
  • communicate fluidly in a team environment
  • find elegant solutions to complex business issues that don’t always involve writing code
  • aren’t agoraphobic – travel is fun!

We:

  • never set foot in a cubicle farm
  • like to play with sleek machines named after fruits and robots
  • inhabit a beautiful building in the Letterman Digital Arts Center in San Francisco
  • love our work
  • prefer Mac and Linux to… other operating systems
  • prefer to work in person with a small, fast-paced team
  • always search for the next hot thing
  • stock beer, tea and snacks in the break room

At pMD you can grow as quickly as you want to. Where else would you have a chance to program a thrilling new feature in the morning, meet with clients for lunch, run an impromptu design meeting in the afternoon, and drink home-brewed beers with the team after work? Plus, you’ll be able to see the impact of your work immediately and you’ll hear from our users how your efforts have improved their lives.

about:
viagogo is the world’s largest ticket marketplace, headquartered in Switzerland, with local language websites in nearly 50 countries.

viagogo provides choice, convenience and consumer protection, so that people can buy and sell tickets for live events all over the world with confidence:

  • Our secure online marketplace has tickets to thousands of sports and entertainment events, even if they are sold out at the box office
  • We guarantee that buyers will get the tickets they paid for, in time for the event, or we will provide replacement tickets (or, in the rare cases where this is not possible, a full refund)
  • Our strict consumer controls have significantly reduced the amount of fraudulent tickets being resold
  • All tickets are delivered by a secure method, either electronically, by courier or at one of our pick-up points
  • We provide a high level of customer service, in six languages, seven days a week

Nearly a hundred of the world’s leading sports and entertainment properties partner with viagogo to help them control and manage the resale market for their tickets.

We work with more than 30 football clubs in the UK, Germany, France, Italy, Spain and the Netherlands, including some of the biggest names in the English Premier League (e.g. Chelsea FC and Manchester City FC), the German Bundesliga (e.g. Bayern Munich) and Paris Saint-Germain FC in France.

In tennis, we have official partnerships with the Roland-Garros French Open, the Barclays ATP World Tour Finals and the BNP Paribas Masters.

In entertainment, we are the official ticket marketplace of several European music festivals (e.g. the Isle of Wight, Benicassim and Sonisphere), the Boyzone BZ20 Anniversary Tour and Madonna’s recent European tours.

To learn more about viagogo, please visit:

http://www.viagogo.co.uk/about

Please contact for more information.

We leverage the latest technologies and deliver great results.  We have an informal, no-nonsense culture that is growing fast and has big ambitions. This means there is always a lot of work to do and a developer’s contributions are only limited by their ability, creativity, and motivation.

Overview:-

The viagogo web team work on the development of viagogo’s ecommerce website. This team includes front-end Engineers working on HTML5, CSS3, JQuery and .NET MVC 4 Razor. It also includes Engineers developing the scalable backend platform in C#, ASP.NET, SOA, Wcf and MS Sql.

viagogo is looking for experienced and passionate engineers to join our team and contribute from Day 1 to the challenges facing a growing and ambitious company. Work closely with the business and product team to identify and deliver product and code enhancements.

Responsibilities:-

This mid-level role would be an excellent opportunity for a developer wanting to take their career to the next level in a high energy start-up environment. We recruit across all levels and welcome applications from junior, mid, senior and technical architect level candidates. Hard work, desire and excellent technical ability are recognized as key to a successful career within viagogo.  You will possess a demonstrable track record of engineering achievement that you are proud to show off. Deliver code to our production environment from day 1. Follow good architectural practices and deliver on code quality. While maintaining system stability, scalability and performance.

Working within an agile scrum team you will be an active participant in the scrum meetings. Highly analytical, creative, and innovative in solving problems. Keep up to date with the latest developments and drive delivery of solutions.

about:
About Data-Tamer:

Data-Tamer is the first general purpose data curation product to automate all the critical tasks to discover, cleanse, transform, and integrate all of your data sources using a single system. Most data curation tools require extensive human involvement in the curation process, rendering them unable to scale to the number of data sources and amount of data required in today’s enterprises. Data-Tamer provides scalable curation by automating as much of the process as possible, calling on human assistance only when machine learning and statistical algorithms are unable to make decisions.

Data-Tamer reduces costs of integrating, cleaning, and transforming data:

  • Enables enterprises to break the scalability barrier, thereby supporting curation of multitudes of enterprise data, whether in spreadsheets, in databases or on the web.  
  • Enables incremental curation as data sources are added or removed.
  • Continues to deliver on your curation investment by automatically applying learned knowledge to future data curation thus optimizing decisions with lower cost.
  • Contains an innovative expert-sourcing component to ask appropriate enterprise experts, when automatic algorithms require human assistance.
  • Data-Tamer software provides an open architecture that allows interoperability with multiple industry standard data access and integration platforms, for example, eTl tools, eDW and analytic systems.

We offer generous, early-stage equity, market-competitive benefits including Health, Dental, 401K, flexible schedules, etc.
title: Sales Engineer
skills:

  • Good sense of humor, excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • 3+ years of pre-sales experiences.

  • Hands on experience developing with scripting languages, Perl, Python, Shell and Java. Good SQL programming skills.

  • Experience with ETL and monitoring tools is a plus.
desc:
Job Description

Sales Engineer

Data-Tamer resolves one of the most difficult challenges faced by major enterprise companies today, how to broadly integrate and curate many existing and future data sources efficiently at scale.  Our cutting-edge product is the World’s first integrated end-to-end system for automating the data curation process, enabling Big Data analytics.  

Data-Tamer was Co-Founded in the Fall of 2012 by Dr. Mike Stonebraker (CTO) and Andy Palmer (CEO), both were co-founders and former executives of Vertica (acquired by HP in ‘08).  Data-Tamer is based on research conducted at M.I.T., Brandeis, and Qatar Computing Research Institute (QCRI).  We are funded by Google Ventures, NEA as well as several high-profile angel investors and we already have active beta’s with 3 Fortune 500 companies.

Read more about the Data-Tamer system: www.cidrdb.org/cidr2013/Papers/CIDR13_Paper28.pdf 

Press: www.boston.com/business/technology/innoeco/2013/02/new_startup_data_tamer_raises.html

The Role: As one of our first Sales Engineers, you will be responsible for introducing the Data-Tamer platform to our customers, often to c-level executives and their staff. You will work closely with the sales team with global reach and work with customers in proof of concept in pre-sale phase as well as in post production.

This position offers tons of potential. Given our early stage and size, you’d be interacting with everyone on the team (engineering, executives, founders, etc), having a significant daily impact on the growth of the organization.  

  • Introduce Data Tamer system to customers, position its benefits, and recommend solutions.
  • Work directly with customers to understand their needs and develop solutions that fit.
  • Work closely with product development to identify features and product gaps.
  • Develop proofs of concept (PoC), conduct training, develop documentation and demo applications.
  • Continue to be a trusted advisor to customers and in managing the delivery and follow-up of proactive support designed to reduce reactive support cases and costs.

desc:
Job Description

Why Work at Skimbox?

Skimbox is a Boston-based startup spun out of SoftArtisans, a 15 year-old software company. Overarching mission: identify information that is important to our users, and make sure see that's what they see first. Current output: Skimbox Mail, an intelligent inbox tamer. Our recipe for success: supremely talented employees, lean development, boundless pluck, and a close-knit, collaborative environment.

At Skimbox, we welcome all manner of ideas, beliefs, hobbies, diets, and toaster oven preferences. Most of us work from around 10-6, some of us work from 9-5 or 8-4. We like Agile, though we've been to Niagara. Some of us have our own offices, some of us share offices, some of us work in the open office. There are no hammocks, but there is a nap room. Attending conferences and taking classes is encouraged. Amassing new skills is encouraged. Voicing your opinion is encouraged.

The rest of the time? We eat together, go camping, jump out of planes, and even have just enough time for a few games of foosball.

about:
Our team of software engineers and designers are developing mobile applications powered by a cloud-based platform that will run on millions of devices and handle millions of transactions per month. Upside has won awards from both Consumer Goods Technology and Gartner's Cool Vendors in CPG for developing this breakthrough mobile platform which helps consumer brands activate, monetize and shape the behavior of their most influential online fans.  Upside manages huge volumes of semi-structured psychographic consumer behavior data from social media and related real-time mobile transactions to which we apply game mechanics and inductive logic which enables brands to monetize online intent with personalized deals and progressive rewards.  You’ve got it – mobile coupons done right.  We’re located in the Capitol Hill neighborhood in Seattle. Check us out at http://upsideapp.com

Our products have to meet the demanding standards of brands like Coca-Cola as well as being simple enough for your mom to use. We're in a footrace for mobile domination. We're winning but we need to grow our team while maintaining everything that makes us special. Definitely not for everybody. But if you think it might be for you, let's talk!
title: Back-end Engineer
skills:
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

  • 5+ years professional software development experience in C, C++, C#, Java
  • Real-world experience shipping one or more large-scale, high-availability internet applications, client-server programming, load balancing, network security, and internet protocols.
  • Team player with excellent written and spoken English communication skills.
  • Bachelor's degree (BS or equivalent) in a quantitative field (e.g. Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science)

TOP CANDIDATES WILL HAVE:

  • Extraordinary software engineering talent
  • Expert ability to get sh*t done the right way
  • Experience building data stores in Hadoop / HD Insight or similar
  • Familiarity with token-based authentication, ADFS 2.0, permissions a plus
  • Experience engineering, releasing, and supporting both Android and Windows Phone applications is a plus
desc:
Job Description

Seeking spectacular back-end software engineer with a broad set of skills who is self-directed and passionate about innovation and web/mobile technologies.  Our products are three consumer-facing mobile applications (native on major platforms) and one client-facing Web system. All use our back-end RESTful API. Our System architecture is based around Windows Azure VMs, Azure NoSQL Tables, and a C# back-end REST system. We utilize Hadoop clusters (HD Insight) for the large amounts of data generated by clients.

Naturally, we desire a developer with solid skills building systems that integrate Windows Azure tables, MongoDB or other NoSQL system. Previous experience designing and developing an efficient REST API is important. Offering a Query language through the RESTful API is important. LINQ experience or equivalent is very helpful. Your back-end also talks to Facebook, Twitter and other 3rd parties. Threading, waiting, synching, flagging, string concats, regex, blocking/non-blocking , Authing, Hashing, GUIDing and so forth are the things you dream about. Tell us about your fastest server; how many users did it support and how many transactions per second did it service.

Your C# skills should be excellent. Nevertheless, we prefer a developer born in the C/C++ world opposed to pure C#. In this area, you would have used a variety of http and server libraries. Examples include FastCGI, Curl, String operations, URL encoding/decoding, etc. Please list your C/C++ library experience in your resume. You should have some Java experience in order to integrate Hadoop with our back-end. In this area, GREP, Regex Regular expression and SQL experience is helpful.  Azure exposure is not essential; you might have Amazon AWS experience with DynamoDB, S3 storage, and Machine Images as an alternative to the Azure world. Please list your Cloud experience.

We’re a small team, so you need to be self-directed and resourceful. You also need to be open, communicative and available to the various developers using your RESTful API. Your documentation requirements are light but necessary. The clearer your written descriptions; the less questions you will need to answer. And, you should be confident to research and offer architecture and software recommendations.

title: Front End Engineer
desc:
Job Description:         

The New York Times is looking for a front-end engineer to create and maintain cutting-edge tools that allow the newsroom to publish nytimes.com.  We are not looking for a copy/paste hacker who can throw together JS based on sample code, but a serious software engineer who can work independently and build an interface from scratch as readily as build upon and improve an existing application. 

Responsibilities:

Work with other software engineers and the newsroom to create and maintain tools critical to publishing nytimes.com, the newspaper and our apps. 

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
  • 1+ years experience creating and maintaining applications.
  • CSS & JavaScript expertise.  Can read and write CSS, HTML, and JavaScript by hand.  Should be immersed enough in these technologies to have philosophies about the organizing and structuring of client-side code.
  • Strong expertise with at least one common JS framework such as YUI, Prototype, or JQuery (preferred).
  • Competent with interface design (not necessarily visual design, but tool design).  Candidate can put together a compelling prototype without having a design handed off, or can follow existing design patterns to expand on an existing UI.
  • A solid understanding of web application architecture, object oriented software, and design patterns.  We are not looking for a scripter who can follow examples, but someone who fundamentally understands software development.
  • Strong communication skills and willingness to collaborate with end users and iterate software designs based on feedback.   

Plusses:

  • Experience with a JavaScript MVC Framework, such as Backbone.
  • Experience with content management systems or blogging platforms.
  • Experience programming web applications in any object oriented language (Java preferred)
  • Understanding of Web Services: REST & Soap and related frameworks.
  • Comfortable working in a Linux environment from the command line. 
  • Familiarity with AGILE software design concepts 

The ideal candidates will:

  • Be passionate about building great software
  • Have experience engaging in rapid prototyping and iterative product development
  • Be nimble and flexible enough to thrive in a rapidly evolving business environment
  • Be an independent thinker and not a technologist who just executes on specs
  • Have big thoughts and the courage to voice them
  • Have enthusiasm for emerging technologies
  • Grasp the big picture, and
  • Be curious about and engaged in the broader world 

Company Information:

The New York Times Company (NYSE: NYT) is a global media organization dedicated to enhancing society by creating, collecting and distributing high-quality news and information.  The company includes The New York Times, International New York Times, NYTimes.com, INYT.com and related properties. It is known globally for excellence in its journalism, and innovation in its print and digital storytelling and its business model.  Follow news about the company at @NYTimesComm. 

EEO Statement:

The New York Times Company is an equal employment opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, age, disability, national origin, citizenship or any other protected characteristic. The New York Times Company is committed to diversity in its most inclusive sense.

Job Description

We believe in meeting users where they are at, and we are committed at having Mobile as the primary way that individuals interact with our product. We have an iOS App and we are just about to release the first version of our Android App. We have a lot of work and innovation ahead of us on those platforms (and more platforms to come) and we are looking for a Sr. Mobile Developer to join our team to help us make that a reality. 

We are looking for a pragmatic Mobile developer that can work well in a startup environment with many other seasoned developers, designers and consumer product folks. We are currently using a hybrid development model (Native + JS/HTML) to deliver fast experimentation and enable us to find the app sweet spot. 

You will spend most of your time coding new features that delight users, as well as working with other developers to solve big problems. We have a low meeting, low email and low randomization factor so you can focus on what matters. In addition, we believe each person on the company should be able to participate in feature, product and even marketing ideas.

Some of the qualities we expect from you: 

  • You have a passion for great mobile user experience and knowledge of Mobile patterns.
  • You are a fast coder, and you ship high quality features the first time.
  • You are not focused on the perfect solution for a problem, but rather the best solution given the time constraints. You have an attitude towards getting things done.
  • You have worked in a startup-like environment before (or you are ready to join a startup) and you are able to work in an unstructured, ambiguous, ever changing and self-driven environment.
  • You have a passion for the consumer space, and in particular the health and fitness space.
  • You are able to easily operate as an individual to get things done independently, but also work well on a team setting.
  • You have excellent communication skills.

about:
Collective[i] is a multi-petabyte, multi-million user decision support ASP that connects disparate data sources and automates the work associated with analyzing data and sharing knowledge. Our customers are executives who need to be able to extract insights from large, complex data sets quickly and accurately.

Our team is made up of about 35 people who come from all over the world, and from different industries and levels of experience. What we all have in common is the desire to make Collective[i] the best. 

People like working here because they are surrounded by smart, genuine, passionate people, and also because they get to work on really challenging and complex problems that will ultimately change how businesses use Big Data. 

We like to have fun too. We've done poker nights, lunch & learns, a geo-caching tournament, family ping-pong, a tour of the Intrepid, sushi making and more. We also have weekly meetings with our Founders where people can ask any questions they'd like about the business, and these generally turn into great brainstorming sessions. Food accompanies almost everything we do.

Our offices are located in midtown NYC near several subway lines. 

--

Please visit our website and Instagram to learn more!

http://www.collectivei.com/collective-us/

http://instagram.com/collectivei

Working closely with both our Product team and front-end developers, the software engineer will be involved in the complete development lifecycle, and will also be responsible for maintaining a stable portal in a cluster environment.

about:
ABOUT US

Acres 4.0 exists to increase profits for gaming operators. To accomplish that, we’re designing experiences that attract and appeal to new players. Make no mistake, you cannot prosper in the future by simply using traditional games and traditional systems, delivered on a traditional gaming floor populated by products from traditional suppliers.

HISTORY

The first chapter of our story begins in 1981 with our invention of electronic player tracking at Electronic Data Technologies (EDT). Chapter two continues that story with the founding of Mikohn in 1986, where we created the modern progressive jackpot system. Next came chapter three and Acres Gaming in 1993, where we invented the concept of system bonusing. These products are still widely used by virtually every casino in the world. Our fourth chapter, Acres 4.0, began in 2006 and continues today. Our work to create the future of gaming is not trivial and it will take time before we are ready for widespread deployment. Our innovative approach has allowed us to create what we believe is the gaming experience of the future. Our new proprietary electronic pulltab gaming system and other player-centric products allow us to connect with our players like never before.
